result.execSummary:
The defendant TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

AODA assesment and follow through. DVDC assessment and follow through. Anger management counseling and follow through. Any Counseling agent deems necessary. Full time employment or 5 job searches per week

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI

records.addlTxt: Shawano County DNA Proof of Submission

9:20 AM Defendant TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI.  Prosecuting attorney Laura Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters N.C. plea to counts 2, 3, 4, and 5. Remaining Counts will be DRI. Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  State and Defense make sentencing recommendation. Court orders Count 2 2 years probation 6 months i/s with conditions. Counts 3-5 3 years probation 14 months probation and 2 years extended supervision i/s with conditions.

10:39 AM Defendant TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI.  Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kolell asks for an additional date as he is awaiting an offer. Atty. Kolell asks to be heard on bond in 22CF275. State objects. Court denies bond mod. Atty. Kolell will be filing speedy trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

9:16 AM Defendant TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Kolell in court for TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI.  Prosecuting attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kolell presents bond mod. State objects. Court denies bond mod.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:03 AM Defendant TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI in court via Zoom with attorney Matthew Kolell.  Defendant TEENA M. PIOTROWSKI in custody.  Laura Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim rights complied with.  Court questions competance.  Atty Kolell - Sheboygan Co. evaluation found DE competent to stand trial.  Bond motion filed, DE to waive prelim. Court reviews prelim rights and right to appear in person.  DE waives rights.  Court accepts waiver.  

BOND MOTION:
Atty Kolell requests $10,000 signature bond or low cash bond & signature bond.  DE is employed and wants to return to her job.  DE addresses the Court. 
ADA Nelson - DE has 3 open cases in 3 different counties.  DE addresses the Court. 
Court  - DE has not followed bond conditions, will amend bond to:  $250 cash, $10,000 signature bond w/same conditions.  

  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on April 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Atty Kolell - competency raised in Sheboygan Co.  case, has concerns re: competency in this case. Court questions Atty Kolell.  Court orders competency evaluation.  ADA Kaupie - Competency Evaluation completed in Sheboygan Co. Atty Kolell - Sheboygan Case 22CF72.  Court reviews Sheboygan Co. case - eval. ordered, report has been filed.  Atty Kolell - requests STC to allow him to possibly review evaluation.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.
